ghostPage.plaintext:
Everything here is open source. Our development roadmap is focused on our 
mission [https://www.projectliberty.io/#/about] of reclaiming the social graph
for the common good and is guided by our principles.

If this is your first visit, the Decentralized Social Networking Protocol
(DSNP)
whitepaper [https://github.com/LibertyDSNP/papers] is a good place to start.
Where you go after that will depend on your goals; the navigation panel below
gives some useful entry points.

The first and most important entry point is our Discussion Forums
[https://forums.projectliberty.io/]. All questions and suggestions are welcome!
If you’re curious about something or just wondering where the most appropriate
place to start is, please post and we’ll do our best to help. You can also reach
us by filing an issue in any of our repositories. If you need to reach us
privately, please email hello@dsnp.org.

Contribution Guidelines & Community Standards
Development activity across Project Liberty shares a common set of Contribution
Guidelines and a single Code of Conduct. Some repositories will have additional
technology-specific developer documentation, but we try to keep the contribution
workflow as consistent as possible from repository to repository, so that a
participant in one project can easily make contributions elsewhere as desired.

 * Contribution Guidelines
   [https://github.com/LibertyDSNP/project-liberty-web/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md]
 * Code of Conduct [https://dsnp.org/code-of-conduct/]

Reporting Security Vulnerabilities
If you discover a security vulnerability in one of the projects here, and you
feel that it's sensitive enough that it shouldn’t be posted publicly, please
report it (and thank you!).

 * Report Vulnerability [security@projectliberty.io]
ghostPage.html:
Everything here is open source. Our development roadmap is focused on our mission of reclaiming the social graph for the common good and is guided by our principles.

If this is your first visit, the Decentralized Social Networking Protocol (DSNP) whitepaper is a good place to start. Where you go after that will depend on your goals; the navigation panel below gives some useful entry points.

The first and most important entry point is our Discussion Forums. All questions and suggestions are welcome! If you’re curious about something or just wondering where the most appropriate place to start is, please post and we’ll do our best to help. You can also reach us by filing an issue in any of our repositories. If you need to reach us privately, please email hello@dsnp.org.

Contribution Guidelines & Community Standards

Development activity across Project Liberty shares a common set of Contribution Guidelines and a single Code of Conduct. Some repositories will have additional technology-specific developer documentation, but we try to keep the contribution workflow as consistent as possible from repository to repository, so that a participant in one project can easily make contributions elsewhere as desired.

  • Contribution Guidelines
  • Code of Conduct

Reporting Security Vulnerabilities

If you discover a security vulnerability in one of the projects here, and you feel that it's sensitive enough that it shouldn’t be posted publicly, please report it (and thank you!).

  • Report Vulnerability
